mnemonic:
assist [ə'sɪst]
insist [ɪn'sɪst]
desist [dɪ'zɪst]
persist [pə'sɪst] - упорствовать, настаивать
***
ПОМОЧЬ готов, но очень голосист. (это) assist
***
Он НАСТАИВАЕТ, он - голосист. (это) insist
***
ПРЕКРАТИЛ работу геодезист. (это) desist
examples: Stay for supper - I insist!
Mike insisted that he was right.
She kept insisting on her innocence.
I must insist!
She insists the money is hers.
His friends insisted he had no connection with drugs.
I'm afraid I have to insist on the return of my book at once.
He insisted I should take a taxi.
“Come on, let's go.” “Oh, all right, if you insist.”
Feminists insist that women can be absolute equals with men.
They insisted that everyone should come to the party.
They insist on maintaining firm control over the project.
I didn't want to go, but she insisted.
We insist on formal dress for dinner.
It was the height of absurdity to insist on a refund.
Throughout the trial, the prisoner insisted on his lack of guilt.
'Why don't you call them up today?' 'Oh, if you insist!'
At our bank we insist on high standards of customer service.
He insisted upon checking everything himself.
If you insist on painting your house bright orange, everyone will assume you are a kook.
They insist on a guarantee as a precondition of the deal.
Most churches baptize infants but some insist on adult baptism.
Some would insist that the military's budget is still inadequate.
the mindless obstinacy of those people who continue to insist that the earth is flat
